. It is just across the water from
and linked to the island by the (now free)
. Whilst there are not that many actual sights in the village, it makes a good base for some nearby attractions.

value: The Skye Bridge - Linking Kyle of Lochalsh to the Isle

A few trains a day run from
. These trains can also be used to visit
. 4 Trains into Kyle during the Summer months
Several coaches a day run to and from

.

Local buses run every 1/2 hour over the Skye Bridge to

, from where you can pick up more local buses.

During the summer, there are also frequent buses to and from
. At other times the long-distance coaches to Fort William and Inverness can drop you off / pick you up here.
Kyle is small enough to get around on foot.

value: content=Cafe serving home made fresh food and snacks. Adjacent takeaway serving fish & chips, ice creams, kebabs and other hot snacks.Good local following and open all year
alt=(Fish and Chip shop and takeaway)

content=New fish and chip shop in Kyle selling fish and chips, freshly made pizzas, kebabs, locally sourced ice cream, baked potatoes, fresh soup, hot and cold drinks and sandwiches made freshly for you while you wait. Family run establishment in the heart of the village. Ask for their new loyalty card so that with every 7 meal deals get number 8 free.

content=The  Bank House Kyle Village We are conveniently located in the HEART of Kyle village. Opposite the old slipway bus station and 3 minutes by car from Kyle Railway Station, Child friendly, Family run establishment
- a very attractive loch-side village a few miles away by train or car.
- a classic (if restored) Scottish castle at the edge of a loch. See above for buses.
